ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Respondent details
Form used/assessment name
(Manic Episode Criteria), Current Episode: A distinct period of abnormally and persistently elevated, expansive, or irritable mood, lasting at least 1 week.

(Manic Episode Criteria), Worst Past Episode: A distinct period of abnormally and persistently elevated, expansive, or irritable mood, lasting at least 1 week. This question is not available after Gate B.
(Manic Episode Criteria), Current Episode: inflated self-esteem or grandiosity.
(Manic Episode Criteria), Worst Past Episode: inflated self-esteem or grandiosity. This question is not available after Gate B.
(Manic Episode Criteria), Current Episode: more talkative than usual or pressure to keep talking.
(Manic Episode Criteria), Worst Past Episode: more talkative than usual or pressure to keep talking. This question is not available after Gate B.
(Manic Episode Criteria), Current Episode: flight of ideas or subjective experience that thoughts are racing.
(Manic Episode Criteria), Worst Past Episode: flight of ideas or subjective experience that thoughts are racing. This question is not available after Gate B.
(Manic Episode Criteria), Current Episode: increase in goal-directed activity or psychomotor agitation.
(Manic Episode Criteria), Worst Past Episode: increase in goal-directed activity or psychomotor agitation. This question is not available after Gate B.
(Manic Episode Criteria), Current Episode: excessive involvement in pleasurable activities that have a high potential for painful consequences.
(Manic Episode Criteria), Current Episode: distractibility.
(Manic Episode Criteria), Worst Past Episode: distractibility. This question is not available after Gate B.
Influence of Drugs or Alcohol
Longest duration of manic episodes
Notes: 0= No information; 1= One day (Greater than 4 hours during the day); 2= 2-3 Days; 3= 4-6 days; 4= 4-6 days; 5= Multiple weeks; 6= 2-6 months; 7= Greater than 6 months

ElementDescription: Longest duration of manic periods
Notes: 0= No information; 1= One day (Greater than 4 hours during the day); 2= 2-3 Days; 3= 4-6 days; 4= 4-6 days; 5= Multiple weeks; 6= 2 or more months

ElementDescription: Manic Episode - Best estimate of number of episodes
Longest duration of Euthymic mood
Notes: 0= No information; 1= No significant periods or euthymic mood; 2= Euthymic mood lasts 3-6 days; 3= Euthymic mood has lasted 1-2 weeks; 4= Euthymic mood has lasted 2-8 weeks; 5= Euthymic mood has lasted more than 2 months

ElementDescription: Estimated total lifetime duration of Mania/Hypomania
Notes: 0= No information; 1= 1-3 days; 2= 4=10 days; 2= 4-10 days; 3= 10-20 days; 4= More than 20 days
